cfc_exemption: Controlled Foreign Corporation Rules: Exemptions
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest Deduction Limitations

cfc_exemption: CFC exempt if passes the active income test and narrower rules apply if located in a “listed” country
thin_capitalization_rules: 1.5:1 debt-to-equity ratio (15:1 for financial institutions) applies

cfc_exemption: CFC with substantive economic activities exempted
thin_capitalization_rules: Informal 4:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies

cfc_income: All income associated with non-genuine arrangements
cfc_exemption: None
thin_capitalization_rules:
Interest deductions limited to the higher of €3 million or 30% of EBITDA
5:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies to intragroup loans
1:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies to receivables from shareholders or directors, managers, and liquidators

country_limitations: Countries with a tax treaty or Tax Information Exchange Agreement
cfc_exemption: Multiple rules may exempt CFC from taxation
thin_capitalization_rules: 1.5:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies

cfc_exemption: None
thin_capitalization_rules:
3:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies
A surtax for excessive-indebtedness can apply

country_limitations: EU member states and EEA member states or double tax treaty
cfc_exemption: CFC with substantive economic activities exempted
thin_capitalization_rules:
Interest deductions limited to the higher of CZK 80 million or 30% of EBITDA
4:1 debt-to-equity ratio (6:1 debt-to-equity ratio for certain financial services companies) applies

country_limitations: EU member states and EEA member states or double tax treaty
cfc_exemption: Foreign subsidiaries are exempt if less than 1/3 of their income is financial income
thin_capitalization_rules:
4:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies
Interest deductions are limited to 2.7% of assets
Interest deduction limited to 30% of EBITDA
Other rules can apply

country_limitations: EU member states and EEA member states and Switzerland
cfc_income: All income associated with non-genuine arrangements
cfc_exemption: CFC exempt if profits below €750,000 or passive income below €75,000
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to the higher of €3 million or 30% of EBITDA

country_limitations: EU member states and EEA member states or double tax treaty
cfc_exemption: CFC exempt if i) located in EU or EEA and not an artificial arrangement; ii) industrial, manufacturing, and shipping business; or iii) Finland has a double-tax treaty with the foreign country (excluding tax treaty countries mentioned in a "black list")
thin_capitalization_rules:
Interest deductions limited to 25% of EBITDA
Net interest expenses between non-related parties limited to €3 million

cfc_exemption: CFC exempt if located in EU and not an artificial arrangement, or if CFC carries out trading or manufacturing activity
thin_capitalization_rules:
Interest deductions limited to the higher of €3 million or 30% of EBITDA
Different limits apply to related-party debt

cfc_exemption: CFC exempt if located in EU or EEA and not an artificial arrangement
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA if deduction exceeds €3 million

cfc_exemption: CFC exempt if located in EU or EEA country with exchange of information agreement and not an artificial arrangement
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA if deduction exceeds €3 million

cfc_income: All income associated with non-genuine arrangements
cfc_exemption: CFC exempt if i) real economic activity; ii) below certain profit threshold and ratio; or iii) located in country with treaty allowing for an exemption
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to the higher of €3 million or 30% of EBITDA

cfc_exemption: CFC exempt if located in EEA countries or has a double-tax treaty with Iceland and not an artificial arrangement
thin_capitalization_rules:
Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA
Rule does not apply if total interest paid does not exceed ISK 100 million 
Other exemptions can apply

country_limitations: EU member states and tax treaty countries
cfc_income: All income associated with non-genuine arrangements
cfc_exemption: CFC exempt if i) below certain profit and income thresholds; ii) transfer pricing rules apply; or iii) passes the essential purpose test
thin_capitalization_rules:
None
However, in specific cases, interest can be reclassified as a dividend

cfc_exemption: None
thin_capitalization_rules: None

cfc_exemption: CFC with substantive economic activities exempted
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA

cfc_exemption: Various exemptions can apply
thin_capitalization_rules:
3:1 debt-to-equity ratio (2:1 for particular repo transactions) applies
Interest deductions limited to 20% of adjusted income

cfc_exemption: CFC rules don't apply to active income if CFC has fixed facilities engaged in business in the foreign country
thin_capitalization_rules:
2:1 debt-to-equity ratio (6:1 for financial institutions) applies
Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA (financial institutions exempt)

cfc_income: All income associated with non-genuine arrangements
cfc_exemption: CFC exempt if profits below €750,000 or passive income below €75,000 and CFC is not based or incorporated in a tax haven
thin_capitalization_rules:
4:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies for deduction up to €3 million (certain financial institutions exempt)
Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA for deduction exceeding €3 million (certain financial institutions exempt)

cfc_exemption: CFC exempt if country included in white list and not receiving special tax treatment
thin_capitalization_rules:
4:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies
Interest deductions limited to €3 million or 30% of EBITDA
Rule does not apply if entity's debt-to-equity ratio is not (or at most 2 percentage-points) lower than the group-consolidated ratio

cfc_income: All income associated with non-genuine arrangements
cfc_exemption: CFC exempt if i) not an artificial arrangement or ii) accounting profits below €750,000 or less than 10% of operating costs
thin_capitalization_rules:
Informal 85:15 debt-to-equity ratio applies
Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA if deduction exceeds €3 million (financial institutions exempt)

cfc_exemption: None
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA if deduction exceeds MXN 20 million

cfc_exemption: CFC exempt if not an artificial arrangement
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to the higher of €1 million or 30% of EBITDA

cfc_exemption: Limited exemption for certain Australian CFCs
thin_capitalization_rules: Numerous restrictions on debt-to-equity ratio apply

cfc_exemption: CFC exempt if located in EEA country and not an artificial arrangement or located in tax treaty country and not mainly passive income
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to 25% of EBITDA if deduction exceeds NOK25 million

country_limitations: EU member states and EEA member states and Switzerland
cfc_exemption: CFC exempt if not an artificial arrangement
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA if deduction exceeds PLN 3 million

cfc_exemption:
CFC exempt if located in EU and EEA countries and not an artificial arrangement
Other exemptions can apply
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to the higher of €1 million or 30% of EBITDA

country_limitations: Countries with a tax treaty or Tax Information Exchange Agreement
cfc_income: All income associated with non-genuine arrangements
cfc_exemption: None
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to 25% of EBITDA (financial institutions exempted)

cfc_exemption: Substantial economic activities exemption
thin_capitalization_rules: 4:1 debt-to-equity ratio applies

cfc_exemption: CFC exempt if located in EU and not an artificial arrangement
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA if deduction exceeds €1 million

cfc_exemption: CFC exempt if located in EEA and not an artificial arrangement or located in white list countries
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA if deduction exceeds SEK 5 million

cfc_exemption: N/A
thin_capitalization_rules: Debt-to-equity ratios apply and vary by asset class

cfc_exemption: None
thin_capitalization_rules: 3:1 debt-to-equity ratio (6:1 for financial institutions) applies

cfc_exemption: Various exemptions can apply
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to 30% of EBITDA if deduction exceeds GBP 2 million

cfc_exemption: Exemptions for foreign high-taxed income can apply
thin_capitalization_rules: Interest deductions limited to the sum of business interest income, 30% of adjusted taxable income, and floor plan financing interest
